intro: Pachystemon depressus var. mollis, commonly known as the soft-stemmed pachystemon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular ornamental plant in arid regions.
